document.docAuthor: Sroka, Pavel, Godunko, Roman J. & Soldán, Tomáš
document.masterDocTitle: Redescription of the species Procloeon (Pseudocentroptilum) fascicaudale (Sowa, 1985) (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae) with notes to its taxonomic position, biology and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Redescription of the species Procloeon (Pseudocentroptilum) fascicaudale (Sowa, 1985) (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae) with notes to its taxonomic position, biology and distribution

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pseudocentroptilum fascicaudale
Sowa, 1985
: Acta Hydrobiol. , 27 ( 1 ): 75

Pseudocentroptilum fascicaudale
Sowa, 1985
: apud Belfiore & D'Antonio, 1990 , Acta Entomol. Bohemoslov ., 87 : 117 [grouping in P. m o t a s i species-group]

Procloeon ( Pseudocentroptilum ) fascicaudale (
Sowa, 1985
)
: apud
Jacob, 1991
, Verh. Westd. Entom. Tagung , 1990 : 275 [subgeneric status, new combination]

Pseudocentroptilum fascicaudale
Sowa, 1985
: apud
Bauernfeind, 2003
:
Res. Update of Ephemeroptera & Plecoptera, Univ
.
Perugia
,
Italy
: 101 [check-list, Greece ]
Male imago. Body length 6.9–7 mm , forewing length 5.5–5.6 mm , cerci length 11 mm ( 1.6 times longer than body).

Head ( Figs. 2, 3 ) brown, turbinate eyes moderately high, facetted surface elongated, 1.5 times longer than wide. Coloration of the facetted surface ochraceous, bordered with thin yellowish stripe. Shaft pale brownish, darker at the base.

Abdomen pale brown, dorsal surface darker. Sometimes with paler pattern near the anterior margin of some individual terga and darker areas laterally. Abdominal segments I–VI (VII) semitransparent, other segments darker. Cerci pale, yellowish-white, covered with tiny hairs. Articulations dark brown. Every second (more distally every fourth) articulation darker and more distinctive. Distal 1 / 3 of cerci entirely without dark articulations.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 2–7.
Procloeon ( Pseudocentroptilum ) fascicaudale (Sowa, 1985)
, male (2–6) and female (7) imagines: 2, head (lateral view); 3, head (dorsal view); 4, forceps (ventral view); 5, subgenital plate (ventral view); 6–7, hind wing.

TABLE 1. Morphometrics of imagines legs of
Procloeon ( Pseudocentroptilum ) fascicaudale (Sowa, 1985)
. Values are averages from 6 male and 3 female specimens.

subSubSection.paragraph: *Remark: segment I of middle and hind legs is fused with tibia.

Female imago. Body length 6.5–7 mm , forewing length 6–7.5 mm , cerci length 10 mm ( 1.6 times longer than body). Coloration similar to male, slightly paler. Distance between compound eyes 1.7 times eye width, approximately equal to the eye length (dorsal aspect).

Abdomen pale brown, not transparent. Dorsal surface darker, sterna pale whitish, sometimes with paler pattern near the anterior margin of individual terga and darker areas laterally. Abdominal segments I–VI (VII) semitransparent, other segments darker. Cerci of the same type as male.
Male subimago. Body length 6.5–7 mm , forewing length 5 mm , cerci length 7–8 mm ( 1.1 times longer than body) General body coloration pale brownish.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Morphometrics of subimagines legs of
Procloeon ( Pseudocentroptilum ) fascicaudale (Sowa, 1985)
. Values are averages from 2 male and 9 female specimens.

subSubSection.paragraph: *Remark: segment I of middle and hind legs is fused with tibia.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 8–14.
Procloeon ( Pseudocentroptilum ) fascicaudale (Sowa, 1985)
, mature larvae: 8, labrum (dorsal view); 9, labrum (ventral view); 10, left mandible (dorsal view); 11, right mandible (dorsal view); 12, maxilla (dorsal view); 13, labium (dorsal view); 14, labium (ventral view).

FIGURES 15–21.
Procloeon ( Pseudocentroptilum ) fascicaudale (Sowa, 1985)
, mature larvae: 15, gill I; 16, gill II; 17,

subSubSection.paragraph: Abdomen brown, unicolorous, not transparent, apparently darker distally. Thin dark stripe on the anterior margin of individual terga. Cerci pale, yellowish-white, covered with tiny hairs. Articulations at the distal half dark brown.
Female subimago . Body length 6–6.5 mm , forewing length 5.5–6 mm , cerci length 7.5–8 mm ( 1.1 times longer than body). General body coloration pale brownish.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 22–29.
Procloeon ( Pseudocentroptilum ) fascicaudale (Sowa, 1985)
, mature larvae: 22, posterior margin of abdominal tergite (dorsal view); 23, surface of abdominal tergite (dorsal view); 24, tarsal claw (dorsal view); 25, surface of tarsal claw (dorsal view); 26, paraproct plate (dorsal view); 27, segments of caudal filament (dorsal view); 28, egg (general view); 29, surface of egg (details).

FIGURES 30–31.
Procloeon ( Pseudocentroptilum ) fascicaudale (Sowa, 1985)
, mature larvae: 30–31, variability of abdominal terga coloration.

subSubSection.paragraph: Abdomen not transparent, terga with apparent transversal dark lines along anterior margin, sterna pale yellowish. Cerci ringed to more than half their length, covered with short, dense hairs.
Mature larva (male and female). Body length 6.5–8 mm , cerci length 2.7–3 mm . General body color yellowish, with darker brownish pattern on thorax and abdomen.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 3. Morphometrics of larval legs of
Procloeon ( Pseudocentroptilum ) fascicaudale (Sowa, 1985)
. Values are averages from 12 mature larvae.
